content: à pas de loup (wolf), à pas de colombe (dove) (silent commands order world); wolf, war (hunting), dove, order, peace > both silent
Nietzsche’s supreme silence: a fearsome sovereign mistress
the wolf looms, fabulous animal, a fantasma in sense of revenant, wolf more terrifying when not there, a metonymic substitute come to announce/conceal, to manifest/mask
a loup [party mask], feminine visor-effect: see w/out being seen
[re: its double meaning, pas de loup] pas’ savage, stealthy intrusion, an adverb haunts a noun
Pascal: justice w/out force is impotent
brothers as wolves, even enemy brothers [my kind]
[Akela from Jungle Book, Fenrir] Plautus’ homo homini lupus: man as stranger is wolf [sovereign inflection of stranger] > Plato’s wolf-tyrant (lukos) in Republic Book 8 [lycology of politics]
the Thing (Heidegger’s Ding) as Cause, place of assemblies, debates, decisions of justice
acc. Rousseau, chief secures something w/ a view to devouring it (doesn’t actually devour it), annihilates it by keeping for himself: enslavement or food
acc. Rousseau via Caligula, kings are gods, people are beasts > reason of sovereign (man himself disappears btwn beast & sovereign)
man, a hyphen (mediation) in the theo-anthropo-zoological
an analogy [re: beast & sovereign] is always a reason, a logos, a calculus > a relation of production in which identity and difference co-exist
clear signs of culture in animals, even incest taboos [political animal]; re: opposition man/animal > don’t rush to analogize, to resemblance: multiply attention to differences

motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

content: every law (contract, authority, credit) not necessarily political
minimal sovereignty: power to give, suspend, make law

sovereign/beast outside law > beast: violation of law, also Benjamin’s grand criminal, reveals state doesn’t monopolize violence; sovereign: guarantor of law, heterogenous to law > haunting, uncanny fascination: beast/sovereign face
ontological coupling: la bête et (est) le soveraine
“rogue (voyou, Schurke) state”—U.S.’s hypocritical rhetorical stratagem (Chomsky)
analogy [re: beast and sovereign] announces (like a black cloud) the historical (actual & virtual) violences, disasters we won’t (already don’t) have a name for
Hobbes’ sovereignty breaks w/ Aristotle’s political animal [?]
Plutarch on non-cowardice of animals, on humans mimicking carnivorous animals, eating weak ones > sovereignty as devouring? [Rousseau referring to Plutarch]
Rousseau on brutishness of blood eaters, teach children to be vegetarians (Émile)
translators always most vigilant, formidable readers”
sovereignty, devoro, voraz, vorator, devour w/ teeth, rush to bite > kill or mourn the other?

devouring and vociferation (voice exteriorizes what is eaten, what is interiorized) > listening, obeying the sovereign voice through donkey’s ears [sovereign devours, like beast, to speak as sovereign to stupid beast]
a seminar as a fable?
[bibliography of sovereign animals in Bible]
sovereign depicted as artificial monstrosity of the animal [i.e. Leviathan] > figuration: always beginning of a fabulation or affabulation
acc. Aristotle, man is btwn divine/animal as political animal—life outside politics either much worse or much better [outlaw either a beast or a god]
[how can politics rise above the natural while also being a monstrous, bestial fable?]
political sovereignty as the fable of a monstrous animal is prosthetic, prostatic, prosthstatic: supplement that supplements nature by adding an artificial organ, here the state

for Hobbes, man as artist mimics art of God [cf. E Kant-like?]; Leviathan is artificial, thus sovereignty a human artifact, monster prosthetic made in lab, and not indivisible, absolute, as Hobbes argues (commentary > interpretation: consequences beyond explicit intention)
animal-machine, living-machine, machine of death: serving the living > prosthstate, and yet vitalist in that it mimics the body > civil war [like Schmitt?] death of the State
Hobbes: “Soveraignty is an Artificiall Soul” > soul as principle of life, vitality, vivacity
state, a robot, an animal monster, giant prosthesis designed to amplify
ipseity: king, father, husband, master
prosthstatic sovereignty presupposes right of man over beasts
Hobbes shares Freud’s prejudice: only mother is certain generatrix of a child
Hobbes: natural right, war of all against all, applies to animals and men
Freud: all ravenous animals are fathers in disguise
for Freud, thanks to technology, mastery over nature, man has become a “prosthetic God”
Freud speaks of an a-historical stasis of animals due to equilibrium btwn drives/environment [bees have a prehistory?]: mankind an irruption of destructive instinct [as history?]
hallucinatory hymn of beast & sovereign > he who plays sovereign plays the beast
Pascal: whoever acts the angel, acts the beast

by its essence, every decision sovereign & exceptional, escapes order of the possible, the programmable, makes distinction btwn a deciding decision and an undecided one undecidable > supposed decision looks like indecision, nonintention, unconscious, irrational > sovereign looks like the beast
a seminar that teaches knowledge must be w/out fable
“storytelling,” convention of some historical as if, fabular > a moral lesson, a political strategy, pedagogical artifice to credit a fable: to make known (political logic, rhetoric)

fable, for, fari, to speak, to say, fabula, something said > make so as to know: 1) bring knowledge to the other 2) give impression, effect, of knowledge, of knowing, simulacrum of knowing: a savoir-faire to “faire” savoir where there is no knowing worthy of the name
television: the monstration immediately a moral demonstration

fabular dimension of political not just sayings or writings but actions > death & suffering inscribed in affabulatory score (on Television): put living beings on stage to accredit interpretation of narrative, to faire savoir, like Augustine’s making truth, veritatem faciare
TV shows beyond auto-, hetero- censorship
no capital w/out accredited fable > w/ real effects [logic of market part of logic of war]
collapsus of World Trade Center
events of 9/11: know-how of archive, technical reproducibility part of event (political-economy/power of media) > knowing how to cause fear, making known: virtuality of the worst
for Hobbes, sovereignty causes fear & fear makes the sovereign
for Hobbes, only crime where there’s sovereign power

acc. Hobbes, fear exceeds corporeal presence, thus it is the passion/origin of law, the origin of crime too [terror] > no contrary to fear [like Nietzsche’s, Freud’s cruelty]: coextensive w/ all political passion; fear is primarily fear for one’s own proper body, fear is passion of life
thus provisional, historical, always deconstructible > declared immortal because not
obey what protects (double meaning of obliger) > when state says, “I protect you,” it institutes a fear that obliges you, subjects you [Donald Trump]

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: political contract, a prosthesis, nomos as thesis (opposed to physis), convention, positing
Schmitt sees Hobbes as decisionist theorist of sovereignty
for Schmitt, only political theories worthy of the name: pessimistic anthropology, man is a dangerous animal (i.e. Hobbes)
Schmitt: protego ergo obligo is cogito ergo sum of State
[vis-à-vis Schmitt] 3 assertions of political anthropology: 1) prosthstatic sovereignty proper to man 2) absolute indivisibility of sovereignty 3) excludes beast & God
[vis-à-vis Balibar] Bodin, Hobbes—political sovereignty as mimesis of God (the sovereign sovereign): ontotheology of phrase “marks of sovereignty”
majestas, majestatem, akran exousian, kurian arkh[ē], kurion politeuma, segnioria, tismar shabat [see Bennington's footnote for #s of errors in Derrida’s transliterations]
theory of exception impossible as philosophical theory, but thought of exception is necessary

Hobbes’ rage against the liars who appeal (to God) above the sovereign: 1) the lie of immediacy 2) partisans, civil disobedients: place a law above law 3) like the Jews, don’t accept sovereign as lieu-tenant of God > p. 53 [but!] acc. Hobbes, the sovereign mimics God, Christian incarnation; p. 54 lieutenant as suppléant for other along metonymic chain
political philosophers [i.e. Hobbes] show periodized political agenda > while adapting to broader historical sequences
non-response of animal as ultimate difference from man (Kant, Hegel, Heidegger, Lacan, Descartes, Hobbes)
what is proper to man isn’t > look closer
sovereign as God does not (need to) respond [Levinas’ death] > sovereignty expropriates ecstasy of irresponsibility: bestiality, divinity, death (each dogmatically designated as unresponsive)
Montaigne: good marriage should be like friendship; Socrates: only man decides to marry, take a wife
double bind of being inside or outside of marriage (inside/outside cage), double bind of domestication, regret on both sides
Socrates: wolf loves lamb like lover adores beloved
Rousseau confesses: I lived like a werewolf (loup-garou) (outlaw, savage) because I read
not reading: neglect (neglego, neglegere), not gathering (legere), not electing (élire) [one doesn’t have to neglect the book to neglect to read]
chase, hunt, follow, pursue the wolves > to neglect a wolf, is that to chase one away?
insist on the tongue (langue) and the genders it imposes on us [re: la bête et le souverain]
double carry (portée) of mouth (human) & maw (animal): voci-ferates (carry the voice) & devours (voracious carry)
the zooanthropological rather than biopolitical > horizon of BS
sovereign: he, himself, ipse; beast: she, tamed (mastered) > suspension of pendulum is double
potsedere (possess), potest, possum (power, “I can”) > ipse (self & power) > Benveniste thinks etymological shift from power (despotēs) to himself (ipse) enfeebles, not Derrida
master-self, sovereignty (positionality of self: thesis), ipsissimus (the absolutely himself)
sovereignty, in minimal, strict sense, always a moment of dictatorship: a performative verdict, a Diktat, has no account to render other than to itself (ipse)
Benveniste: dem-pot(i)-[skr.], “master of house,” power of oneself [ipse as sovereignty]

international rights & crimes against humanity invoke a sovereignty of man himself (ipse, ipsissimus) above/beyond/before Nation-State sovereignty (Schmitt sees this as Entpolitisierung, humanity not a political concept)
sovereign state as Leviathan, as animal-machine, as prosthstatics > beast et (est) sovereign coupled across a copula: affinity through analogy, proportion, reciprocal fascination—or grafting
Schmitt: “concept of humanity” useful instrument of ideological expansion; Proudhon: whoever invokes humanity wants to cheat
for Schmitt, what’s terrifying (schrecklich) about a Nation’s pretentious appeal to “humanity” is how such a nation treats its enemy as hors la loi, hors l’humanité—treats them like beasts
Schmitt doesn’t like hypocrisy of humanistic allegation/alibi > unehrliche Fiktion (dishonest fiction) of total depoliticization, peace w/out States
repoliticization (another politicization not depoliticization), a slow and differentiated deconstruction occurs in the divisibility of sovereignty already happening
Schmitt: war should speak its name: be honest, honorable (Ehre)
Schmitt argues [and Derrida doesn’t (entirely) disagree]: Left uses hugely murderous weapon of “humanitarian,” “humanistic”
Derrida intentionally neglected to introduce a wolf in Machiavelli [?]

“reason of strongest always best” is violently tautological [Derrida’s “gonna show” this tautology, but never does, thus (as the professor, as the strongest in the room) he does show it (a performative demonstration)]
analogy as mediation, Kant’s schema of imagination: btwn intuition & concept of understanding
inventive, passionate, compulsive hallucination of fantastical beasts (zoopoetic fictions): essential structure of political sovereignty, codified rhetoric, law of genre [?]
chase chimeras, centaurs: to forget them, domesticate them, repress them, cause them to flee
to lie: one is not addressing the other as man > Machiavelli offers this Kantian argument but concedes that when faith in law doesn’t work a prince should become a beast
sexual desire—beastly
sworn enemy always a wolf
know-how of fox, cunning, know-how to trick, perjure, dissimulate, not make known; p. 90 le savoir-faire sans faire-savoir (know-how w/out making known)
for Machiavelli, fox is closest to truth of man and man’s fidelity: knows who to lie, commit perjury, has sense/culture of snare [for Machiavelli, lion is too bête]
from Chomsky, U.S. military tactics purposely out of control to seem blind, seem crazy, like an animal
[Derrida disputes Lacan’s “animals cannot cross certain threshold of dissimulation”]
le savoir-faire sans faire-savoir (know-how w/out making known)

[Derrida savages Agamben’s dogmatism in declaring who was “first,” then dogmatism in accusation of negligence, points out abyss of neglect, “one is always a priori negligent,” asks about the ethical responsibility in Levinas’ anarchy (no first)]
bêtise, bestiality, proper to man
for Rousseau, outlaw is “w/out faith or law”
what is proper to man throws certain [Nation-State] sovereignty into crisis
for Rousseau, the Christian and the philosopher cease to be beast or wolf
more than one psychoanalysis, heterogenous
Lacan’s “return” to Freud [proclaimed loyalty to psychoanalytic tradition] both helps us & forbids us from thinking
to uniquely human “I” of Descartes and Kant, Lacan adds superego (Law/Crime) > i.e. animals don’t have superego
Lacan’s psychoanalysis does distance itself from genetic predisposition toward crime [i.e. born to be a serial killer], but…
Derrida one of the few who smiles at machine of presuppositions to be deconstructed in “law,” “freedom,” “institution,” “culture”
Lacan’s “fellow” [?] seems to follow Greco-Abrahamic, & especially Christian, notion of “neighbor,” “brother,” as totality of all creatures [re: when we treat animal as “fellow”]

Derrida has attempted [throughout the years] to oppose/distinguish justice from right > obligation to le plus dissemblable, the méconnaissable—monstrously other: beginning of ethics, Law, is not human
so long as there is recognizability & fellow, ethics is dormant
fraternalism frees us from all ethical obligation toward our non-fellow; worst human violence committed against humans considered non-fellows
oath of brothers after founding criminality [killing baby daddy], trace of primitive crime remains ineffaceable in egalitarian, compassional, communitarian fraternity
obligation to fellow, even if it’s a fact (can a fact ground, justify an ethics?), will never have founded a right, an ethics…

is Derrida just widening the parameters of “fellow”? no, the monstrously other binds me to the nonliving & inscribes concept of death in life > do we find a comparable obligation to the dead in murder of primal father [Freud]?
animal rights a translation of rights of man, a Cartesian/Kantian logic which reduces animal to machine
Flaubert: science must treat men like mastodons & crocodiles
talk of the bottom (fond), the profound, believing in depth [of “who” or “what”] will never be free from bêtise (stupidity) > sovereign & beast as bottomless bottom, abyss, vertigo
“who” and “what” sink into indifference, into the abyss of who-becoming-what (death)—becoming what we will have always been
if bêtise is proper to man, autopositing the proper is stupidity itself
sovereign, the arkhē, capital, chief, king, who can lose his head, go mad
anthropocentered, humanistic logic: sovereignty of Law, freedom, responsibility (response) opposed to animal fixity, program, imaginary, hard-wired, coded reaction
[on Lacan’s “subject of the signifier”]
acc. Deleuze, psychoanalytic bêtise privileges depth of fantasy over planar affect, becoming-assemblage
Deleuze accuses psychoanalysis (Freud) of dispossessing (brutalizing w/ machines of war) the Wolf Man (much like Artaud’s complaint about theft of his proper name)
Lacan accused Derrida of “coupling” [?] Torok & Abraham

“how is a synthetic a priori possible?” and Deleuze’s “how is bêtise (and not error) possible?”: transcendental questions of possibility > but, Deleuze’s question removes possibility from epistemological economy, from determination of Being, from objectivity of object
for Descartes, bêtise would occur btwn infinite will & finite understanding; the excess, disproportion of will (freedom) over understanding leaves abyssal/vertiginous possibility of bêtise

for Descartes, bêtise would occur btwn infinite will & finite understanding; the excess, disproportion of will (freedom) over understanding leaves abyssal/vertiginous possibility of bêtise ——if bêtise is not an error [Deleuze’s stance], no pragamatic use of bêtise does not refer (if obscurely) to abyss of jus (justice, justness, judge) [not faulty judgment but judgment of judge, judgment from which one expects some justness]
if bêtise not an error (bad judgment) but hebetated (dulled) judgment, aptitude for wrong judgment, it could be there in absolute knowledge [stupidity of encyclopedic knowledge]
for Deleuze, bêtise [ethical, quasi-juridical fault] at heart of philosophy > makes modest
katēgoria (accusation, blame)
katēgoreuō (decry, accuse in legal proceedings) also means to attribute, to say something about something: “S is P”
transcategorial—“qui transcendit omne genus”: does not belong to series or table > is bêtise a transcategorial category, a quasi-transcendental?

for Deleuze [?], bêtise is thoughtful, a thinking, a matter of thought, a thinking and thoughtful freedom (i.e. proper to man) > Deleuze’s bêtise has a relation to ground (also Ungrund) influenced by Schelling’s discourse on human freedom
for Schelling, only man w/ his freedom can relate to a groundless ground
for Schelling, there’s distinction btwn being (Wesen) as Grund & being as existence > must be Wesen prior to any ground: Urgrund or Ungrund that would not be oppositional, absolute indifference
animal cannot be bête, not free, can’t come away from relation to ground
Blödsinn, Avital Ronell’s Stupidity; groundless ground of bêtise links it to sovereignty, cruelty, thought
acc. Deleuze, “best” literature, not pseudo-literature, not philosophy, lets itself be haunted by bêtise
bêtise can always be mine, turns around like “category of accusation,” betraying my fault > contagion, being-with of bêtise
[vis-à-vis Flaubert] bêtise of hunting bêtise, seeing only bêtise; absolute knowledge as very element of becoming-bête, as sovereignly bête
only a becoming-bête > no bêtise in itself [not Deleuze’s becoming-animal]
bêtise as becoming “what” of “who”—monument, stone, becoming-thing of proper name
bêtise as madness of definition, “S is P,” definite articles le or la, bêtise is defining as much as defined > the category is a signature of bêtise
for Flaubert, stupidity is wanting only noon and midnight
groundlessness, no fundamental meaning of bêtise
Kleinigkeit, Geringfügigkeit, Belanglosigkeit, Nichtigkeit, Dummheit, Torheit, Unsinn, Blödigkeit, blunder, silliness, foolishness, triviality
abyss of translation [w/in language, btwn species] makes so-called human/animal opposition a bêtise > the privilege of bêtise
only in French is bêtise related to animal bête [see p. 170 stupidity is related to animal in Spanish, Italian, Greek?]
can you swear an oath that you know what you mean to say w/ word bête???
one is never bête all on one’s own: class-structure in accusation of stupidity [re: Flaubert, Valéry]
use of bêtise always a stratagem, act of war, violence that intends to wound
Kant’s distinction btwn conflict (Streit) & war (Krieg): an institution (3rd party) must know exactly what the accusation means [re: bêtise] for it to achieve rational status of conflict
if I swear that I know what I mean when I injure someone [w/ bêtise], I perjure myself > bêtise always perspectival
accusation of bête deprives the accused, like animal, of all that is proper to man (language, reason, logos, sense of death, technique, history, convention, culture, laughter, tears, work)

still, difference btwn these words can only be marked in context, which doesn’t imply an absolute relativity of context: bêtise can’t mean anything at all, not an idealized, objective, “free” ideality > translation problems occur in same language, same cultural code
bêtise not exactly stupidity, foolishness, imbecility, idiotic, Dummheit, Kleinigkeit, etc. [example of nonsynonymous synonym]
from apophantics to apophatics: trying to describe bêtise [vertigo]
inane (sot), ass, knows knowing—not bêtise
bêtise as ambiguous hetero- or self-accusation: I’m too good, too bête
Avital calls stupidity a quasi-concept: so unstable, subject to variability, plasticity—not secure
apaideusia, uncultivated, aphronesis, lack judgment, anaisthetos, insensitive, agroikos, uncouth
Derrida stresses “quasi” because it relates to a feint or an “as if”
Heidegger [re: commitment to Nazism in 1933-34]: “I did a Dummheit”
sovereign decision, mad and bête
Ronell: philosophy & stupidity, nothing more stupid than Hegel’s absolute knowledge
but also: point d’intraduisibilité (point of untranslatability, no untranslatability [at all]): no pure translation or untranslation (I can spend a page explaining what can’t be translated)
[re: bêtise as stupidity] the remainder/remnant is untranslated/untranslatable: totality of idiomatic network that coordinates values, quasi-synonymies, homonymies (i.e. bêtise and bête)
idiom (extraordinary magnetic field of meaning links idios of particular, singular idiom to idiotes, idiocy of simple, ignorant, naked, savage man)
nonknowledge of bête > spirit of seminar

nonknowledge of bête, spirit of seminar; the living in life itself outplays opposition btwn bêtise and its supposed contrary > Nietzsche one of most eloquent witnesses of this theme: both man & animal, both idiotic & cunning—no decidable limit
Husserl’s free ideality (i.e. the number “two” repeated identically) vs. bound (gebundene) idealities (ideal only in body)

if very meaning of lexicon of bêtise, being-bête, is not absolutely translatable (abyss of translation), one cannot reserve bêtise for man as sovereign & free > if meaning is linked to relation of forces, distinction btwn reaction/response loses its rigor and decidability [must revise everything]
difficult for Derrida to laugh very long w/ Deleuze [re: jokes against psychoanalysis]
“I do not wish to homogenize things and erase differences,” but no criteria to conclude that man alone is exposed to bêtise, no criteria to exclude the animal

motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

content: Derrida intentionally using “a Nietzschean-style language more acceptable to Deleuze”: force, differential, intensity (not Freudian unconscious)
abyssal depths, pretension, of Monsieur Teste’s “la bêtise n’est pas mon fort”

pitiless lucidity of cogito, triumph of conscious self-positing self, the thesis of self always reflects itself as bêtise, bêtise always triumphs > Triumph of Life in bêtise ——bêtise always on side of victor > bêtise must not find itself bête: that would be suicidal
force-differential (unconscious mechanisms) btwn which tension/contradiction bound to localize > bêtise on both sides: side of sovereign (who), side of beast, the stupid, the other (what)
truth of bêtise: upping ante, denying it (hyperbolically), always adds a supplement of bêtise
Celan: the artist turns nature to stone, “be a Medusa’s head” (monkey, automata, art)
[feminine?] marionette: btwn who/what, sensible/insensible—tekhnē btwn art & technique, btwn life & politics
in Kleist’s “On the Marionette Theater,” consciousness that passes through infinity becomes pure unconsciousness, that of a god or mannequin, grace of prosthesis
Valéry & Monsieur Teste doubles of marionettes—who makes who speak?
Valéry: “IN THE BEGINNING WAS THE FABLE [speech], it will always be”
for Valéry, Poe higher than anyone/anything else

[têtu, entêté] essence itself as headstrong stubbornness in being, bêtise, pigheadedness (entêtement)? the marionette (other) in me I wish to condemn to death? > bêtise hits you over the head (tête), acephalic manner > bêtise not proper to man, but to all those capital beings w/ heads?
I kill bêtise first, I kill the marionette in me, the animal-machine (so as not be killed by it)
[vis-à-vis Valéry] bêtise, particularity rather than generality, when the “I” takes itself for the whole > thus, to be rich in spirit, in opposition to bêtise, would be to know how small you are
[Monsieur] Testes, tête, test, terstis (third), témoin, testicles
free sovereignty over social body & one’s own body (like the king’s 2 bodies) > duel w/ marionette transforms winner into a machine (in playing angel, one plays the beast [Pascal])
Valéry: weakness of force to believe only in force
Derrida points out decreasing statistical series in Valéry: seen many…visited few…played my part
faire l’amour / faire la moue (distaste)
quoi as coite from quietus (silence) [who > what: silencing]turns who’s into what’s
in Monsieur Teste, a Nietzschean kind of superman, infinitely cunning and infinitely bête solitary types: incalculable/hyperbolic arithmetic turns “who” into “what” [see pp. 200-01 in CAP(ITAL)]

Valéry wagers on CAP: le cap Pensée; the high point (comble) of internal politics, a multipli-city of selves, when the excess that exceeds un-counts the other & outside > jealousy is always the hight point that completes me, supplements me because receives, welcomes, no longer chases out other in me: one only ever jealous of oneself, the selfsame > explains all the loves and wars (which take place btwn the same, the others as the same): as soon as there’s a double capitalized phallic erection (CAP, standing, being on a cape) here called Thought
hardness of capital erection [CAP] turns woman into beast
the World Trade Center as image of Valéry’s double capitalized phallic erection (jealous of themselves) > double turn makes one think of double tower (tour)
Valéry [in Monsieur Teste] tries to neutralize/master Unheimlichkeit [see BSi pp. 200-01 in CAP(ITAL)]
sovereign, highest, most eminent capital or capitalization, monopolizes force/violence—Gewalt—gives reason in advance to force through right
avoir raison des autres: “to prevail over” the others

[vis-à-vis Fontaine] that the sovereign’s [wolf’s] power (rage) is always an act of revenge, thus the beast [lamb] has originary guilt (ursprüngliche Schuldigsein): “si ce n’est toi, c’est donc ton frère”
[vis-à-vis Cixous] love of wolf—love of fear, wolf loves by consum(mat)ing > nothing stronger than love, save death
“excellently eminent and excellently phallic erection of sovereign highness”
erected marionettes, Sovereign in its Majesty, Most High—not merely a trope, [it’s sublimity is even practical]: surveillance (economic/military) strategy
appeal to reason, a reason that is not one, as fact of name and force of the stronger
sovereign is the only one to name himself: ipse, to himself, to his title, to his name, to his might > majestas (from magnus, major), highness, grandeur, dignity, Kant’s Würde
[vis-à-vis Fontaine] the lion’s sovereignty: 1) his name, Sire 2) common right—like others 3) courage, right to take 4) fear he inspires
deciding actors [political leaders] consecrated by election of their erection to status of marionette in the puppet show [in English]
power that makes the law, legitimation of arbitrary violence, passes via fable
Celan: poetry a turning of breath (Atemwende)
never certain of distinction btwn 2 marionettes, [its force, its fable] discredits lebendige Gegenwart, Husserl’s living now

to think the marionette, difference btwn marionettes, not the living of life but a living w/out being—simulacrum of being, prosthesis, substitute for the being of the thing itself—fetish—life death at same time > marionette [Marion’s Dieu sans l’Être]
phallic figure haunted by virgin girl
quasi-mechanical, automatic reaction of phallic erection

sexual difference, 2 marionettes—those afraid of “it’s not so simple,” afraid of sexual difference, of equivocality of living being: of the subtle difference, or blurred difference, btwn sponte sua, autonomy, and reactive automaticity
phallus as marionette avant la lettre: simulacrum, prosthetic, automatic machine—is the phallus human at all? > phallic erection is a machine but also the attribute of sovereignty
[in some cultures] women break their hymen on wooden phallus (simulacrum of phallus)
ithyphallic: hardness, straight, rigid, standing phallus
priapism is infinite ithyphallism, foreign to finitude of erection (finitude makes erection possible) > thus, is detumescence castration?

for Derrida, hypothesis that bêtise always threatens imperturbable ithyphallus is the essential ithyphallic bêtise > ithyphallus’ hyperbolical desire is nil/empty of thought, this void pushes, pulses, compulses, makes one think of a drive that is absolutely bête, never gives up anything, absolute stranger to all thought
configuration of motifs vs. diachronic linear reading (read whole text from A to Z) [baby daddy]
Mallarmé told Degas poetry not made w/ ideas but w/ words
[vis-à-vis Celan] January 20th [date Hitler drew up plans for ‘final solution’]—anniversary of death > sovereign decision to commit genocide
Celan’s 2 secrets of the poem: 1) signature, genesis of poem 2) the present that doesn’t present itself
poetic signature: not essence but where poem is coming/going: frees itself, by art, from art
[Celan] French Revolution (monkey & marionette), beast and sovereign, “Long Live the King”—majesty of present [a transference of sovereignty?]
sovereignty of poetry (dynamics of majesty/sovereignty), hyperbolic surenchère (Bataille’s sovereignty, Nietzsche’s superman)
turn as turning of breath—inspiration itself
mitsprechen: mit as condition of solitude, speaking with or to: con-voke, co-loquate
Celan, like Heidegger, evokes an impulse or step that gathers more than one in it
for Celan, letting the other speak what in the other is most other: let time speak
does a snake have a head? [CAP vs. Face]
“after you”: my first address to other as other
“smoke”: extraordinary word in French and English
[re: D.H. Lawerence’s poem “Snake”] scene of hospitality at water source
D.H. Lawerence: “I despised myself and the voices of my accursed human education”
in D.H. Lawerence’s “Snake,” “my snake”: declaration of love comes after virtual/aborted murder
[re: “Snake”] sovereign as guest (hôte) commands, the first comer, comes before me
reconstitute sovereignty by 1) transferring it to the other, i.e. no longer my sovereignty 2) or should the idea itself be contested?
moral law already there before murder of father because it actualizes after remorse for the murder (not after the murder itself) [i.e. moral law born of remorse, already there]
snake, beast, low; albatross, sovereign, high
[Derrida tells a good joke?] “the one to be sorriest for [in Eden] is the snake”
those asking for hospitality are exiles
exergue (ex-ergon)—like parergon, out of work that puts to work > but like capital too: makes work happen, comes at head (inscribe date)
Medusa as capital head—erection, castration
[via Celan via Büchner’s Danton’s Death] art as species of marionette > marionette: an allegorical personification of technē, technical who and what
enriching our bestiary (wolf, dolphin, monkey—queen bee)
[“you’re stupid”: Cartesian, apocalyptic verdict, final judgment]
if phallus is proper to sovereign, is it proper to man?
17th century sovereign referred to as “Your Altitude”

Nietzsche’s superman, and the sovereign too, a hyperbolic, sublime, “higher than height,” more about excess than height, it’s the more than that counts, the surplus, absolutely more: could as well be a maximum of smallness, God as small (sovereign use of nanotechnology)

motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

content: [review of marionette: life/death; virgin/phallus; spontaneous/automatic]
division or parting of pinpoint (punctuality of now) in Celan
Celan’s time of the other, beyond calculable speaking time or vote counting that elects sovereign
via Celan, art as unheimlich, containing the inhuman: Medusa, monkey, automata, marionette

unheimlich: 1) worrying aspect of foreignness as intimacy of one’s own home 2) says the essential bearing of Celan’s “Meridian” 3) associated w/ the foreigner 4) Geheimnis (the intimate, the folded back on itself, what has withdrawn in withdrawal, hidden inside of house and home), secret of encounter at most intimate heart of present
Heidegger’s problem w/ zōon logon ekhon, it’s “zoological,” late-on-the-scene, does not question the essence of life
Unheimlichkeit just as important for Heidegger as for Freud (but scarcely pointed out)
Celan: poem needs the other, reaches, searches, addresses the other
for Heidegger, in the questioning essence of man, man comes to himself as “who” not “what” (ipseity [Selbst] before any “I,” individual, we or community)
acc. Heidegger, man is the most unheimlich—steps out of usual frontiers (Grenzen) of habit > man’s Grundzug (fundamental feature): being foreign to everything familiar
Heidegger doesn’t say “there’s nothing proper to man,” but that the property of what is appropriated is strange, unfamiliar to interior of home
man sovereignly excels in being unheimlich
[vis-à-vis Celan] poetry as way, step, coming of event, arrival
[method in seminar] experience w/ you, and reconnoiter the corner turned
Celan: “whoever walks on his head has heaven beneath him as an abyss (Abgrund)”
sovereignty of self-present ipseity, only man can say “I”—autodeictic (Kant, Heidegger, Descartes)
in Celan, “perhaps’s” withdraw poem from dimension/authority of knowledge
Celan’s tout autre [ganz Andere] not alter-ego, not another living present, but inaccessible other
Celan: poem speaks in the cause of the strange, “vielleicht in eines ganz Anderen Sache”
Celan: are we not all descended from such dates [January 20th]?
poetic revolution (beyond sovereignty [?]), revolution in revolution—minuscule dethroning of majesty exceeds knowledge > signed by repetition of “perhaps’s,” “who knows”
tout autre can’t resemble or be introjected, assimilated into mine: chance of encounter, event, takes one’s breath sway—turns it [is tout autre sovereign or sovereignty of no sovereignty?]
Derrida remains enamored by Jardin des Plantes [in spite of its sovereign institutionalism, zoo-like]

an autopsy [the seminar too?], the becoming-what of the who? ——response to questions “so what, so who?” meant to enrich my science, knowledge, conscience through onto-logy, theatrical theorein (optical gaze) > sovereign autopsy
don’t we need to know what knowledge is absolutely before we know absolute knowledge?
the pas of “who knows” and “perhaps” suspends order, authority—not in name of obscurantist propaganda
“beast & sovereign” as an incitement to think limits of knowledge (horizon that will constantly border but also un-border)
knowledge no stranger to power, power no stranger to seeing, having, willing > autopsic/autoptic knowledge: take power over object of knowledge

sovereign majesty & bestiality as more than [see pp. 256-59], as upping the ante, going outside the law to make the law; the “perhaps” that does justice to the possibility of pas and event, “liberated, cleared, disengaged by wagering (dégageaient, désengageaient en la gageant)” ——“perhaps,” “who knows,” as link, separating hyphen btwn beast/sovereign, inviting us, w/out ordering us, to go over the limit of knowledge

motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

content: for Heidegger, the object is Vorhandensein—the dead body of living being (animal or man) is neither Dasein, nor Zu-, nor Vor-handensein [?]
narcissism of autopsy occurs after narcissistic hunt, capture > this setup mediated by institutions
elephenomenelephant [Sun King inspecting dead elephant to assert sovereignty]

French Revolution inaugurates new form (sovereignty of people, international model) of same fundamental structure of sovereignty (knowing-power, knowing-how-to-see): walls destroyed, but architectural model not deconstructed
zoos profitable to knowledge and economy [physiocratic theory of economy]
nomos of oikos: taming, training, the domus of the dominus > oikonomia also general condition of ipseity as sovereign mastery over beast
representation/performance of autopsy
Derrida mocks the circus of modern political actors > kissing babies: pâté de campagne
after death, “dignity” of king’s body during lifetime separated from “sovereignty” (majesty) that survives him, is inherited from one king to next
[bibliography re: king’s 2 bodies] king’s living (mortal) body has at its disposal an eternal, celestial, sublime body
layers of light in spectacle of autopsy [includes the historiography of Louis XIV’s autopsy]
as soon as there is absolute knowledge, everything prescribed for Sun King as a program [the king, the historian, the reader—who isn’t manipulated by history like a marionette?]

narrative/representation structural to sovereignty, its force, its dynamis and its energeia (virtual & actual power) > sovereignty draws all its power from simulacrum-, fiction-, representation-effect > mystification of representation constituted by the simulacrum of a true transfer of sovereignty
Bemächtigungstrieb: beyond other drives, beyond death drive, think sovereignty through drive, transference, inheritance, transmission, sovereignty itself is nothing, is excess, beyond everything
political revolution w/out poetic revolution of political > just a transfer of sovereignty
trap of sovereignty, trap of transfer of sovereignty > in all these fictions and simulacra blood flows, no less cruelly, irreversibly: beast & sovereign bleed, so do marionettes
scene, theater, visibility of autopsy [sovereign]: violence of light > enargeia of seeing, knowing; enargeia: fulguration of sun, can’t look at directly
Descartes’ Treatise on Man treats human body as “machine of earth” (compares to clocks, artificial fountains) > animal-machines in Descartes
visor-effect: king sees w/out [his gaze, origin of his seeing, his eyes] being seen
[vis-à-vis Marin] autopsia: seeing w/ one’s own eyes, bear witness to authentic past event, narrator a “witness,” “martyr”
[during spectacle of autopsy/sovereignty] an éclat > fragment of light touches everything
autopsy should be called necropsy [used to mean intimate commerce w/ gods?]
Marin adds 3rd body to king: 1) historical–mortal 2) politico-juridical 3) sacramental > acc. Derrida, #2 allies itself w/ #3
globalization of autopsic model, knowledge that de-vitalizes by looking at life (simple objectification) > the 2 senses of autopsia: cadaver & divine power

curiosus: avid knowledge and care (cura), Heidegger’s unwholesome curiosity (Neugier, Neugierde) > curious in the beast, in the madman (zoo, asylum): caring and locking up, installing limits, an art and technique, perhaps tekhnē itself
Derrida on how zoos hide limits, interiorize, hollowed-out (en creux) limits [ditch instead of bars] > repressive violence w/ liberal, idealist, spiritualist grimace
treatment, curiosity, autopsy: expropriating the other

liberty & sovereignty (its limitless “I can”) are indissociable, double bind in 2 senses: 1) double injunction 2) duplicity in very concept of binding, obligation, bind, bond: stricture rather than structure, stricture that limits liberty along w/ sovereignty or sovereignty along w/ liberty
culture of curiosity, treating, curing: violence of enclosing/objectifying

double bind [#1 above]: deconstruct ontotheology of sovereignty w/out questioning liberty in name of which we put this deconstruction to work: think liberty differently, w/in distribution of a divisible sovereignty > think unconditional w/out indivisible sovereignty
if double bind (implacable contradiction) ever lifted (that’s impossible, how could anyone wish for it?) > paradise; can only dream of paradise (absolute felicity and inescapable catastrophe)
Persian paradeisos: an animal farm [a mystical zoo?]
Lacan: Oedipus story, a less cretinizing (abêtissant) version of Original Sin > Derrida wonders [coyly] whether everything in BS deals w/ castration
for Heidegger, Den Eigensinnigen ist Leben nur Leben, for the stubborn, for those with one thing in mind, life is only, merely, life > stubborn bêtise that doesn’t ask any questions
Derrida speaks of Heidegger’s arrogant, smug condescension [still, Derrida likes it?]
can we really separate bios and zōē ?
bêtise as self-positing, positivism, positivity itself, across all 3 modes (question, affirmation, negation) > but affirmation, the “yes,’”is not to be reduced to positivity [?]
Heidegger’s stubborn stupidity: only man has a relation to dying (sterben) as such
bêtise as stubborn opinion of life & death, one proper meaning for each
logics of closure/enclosure, the threshold, le seuil interdit, question of responsibility (a question of threshold) throughout a decade of seminars [Derrida’s]
not only do we not have a key to threshold, deconstruction doubts existence of threshold worthy of the name (threshold supposes indivisibility & solidity of ground)
threshold (seuil), sill, soil, sole, solum, ground > are these ever secure?

question of responsibility is a question of threshold, from which one passes from reaction to response, same threshold as liberty, indivisible limen btwn beast & sovereign [these humanistic figurations of the threshold are being deconstructed]
every economy & ecology presupposes limits, thresholds, and therefore (bunches of) keys
supervised liberty is most common condition, and therefore supervised sovereignty > who would dare say we want to escape it?
zoos, asylums: made people, all the mad animals, love the ecosystem of limits
trousse (case, kit), trousseau (bunch of keys) > the etymology of these words includes everything Derrida’s been working on in BS [how Derrida can open up to “everything”—elsewhere, again]
threshold as solid, indivisible, threshold as arkhē: commencement and commandment > archon, figure of sovereign himself
Abrahamic commencements: 1) Bereshit, Genesis—animals before man 2) en arkhē en o logos, sovereign all-powerful creator of everything, Head, fiat of a logos producing zōē, light, phōs
for John, there must be an ontological affinity btwn life, zōē, and logos [in the beginning was the word] > zoo-logy, a life in logos, a zōē
when was distinction btwn zōē/bios ever secure?; p. 317 Derrida doesn’t understand Agamben sometimes
Heidegger asks how logos became Herrschaft (sovereign, master) over Being
Heidegger’s gathering: retains in a mutual belonging w/out dispersion

logos or legein as gathering (more originary than logos as reason/logic) still deploys force/violence, a Durchwalten of physis > physis as Gewalt: deployment of sovereignty, of force [of logos] (no dissolving into void), in the highest acuity of its (sovereign) tension (Spannung)
acc. Heidegger, logos becomes Jesus by way of Philo, who attributed to logos function of mediator (mesitēs) > distancing logos from its Greek originarity (what holds contraries together)
logos of John not a Heraclitean gathering of contraries, instead designates one particular entity [see p. 338]
ten commandments (oi deka logoi), logos as kērux, kērigma, holy proclamation, also logos as angelos, herald, gospel, logos of redemption, logos of eternal life, logos of zōē, i.e. Christ
logos: exercise of force or violence (Gewalt)
Heidegger’s talk against biologism, critique of something in Nazism
Heidegger against strict, conventional division of man/animal [for very different reasons than Derrida], doesn’t make man unique enough
Heidegger against science: the face nature turns toward man’s technical mastery might simply conceal her essence
Heidegger’s critique of biologism, i.e. biopoliticism: ek-sistence not simply a specific kind of living creature
[more Agamben bashing, zoopolitics preferable to biopolitics]
Derrida does not accept Agamben’s distinction btwn “attribute of the living being” and “specific difference that determines the genus zōon”
Derrida believes there are new things happening w/ bio-power but not that it’s new—it’s arch-ancient, bound w/ very idea of sovereignty
we are all grateful for Foucault and Agamben’s confusions/contradictions [re: biopolitics and periodization], they compel us to reconsider a way of thinking and doing history

motifs of the passage of what passes and comes to pass (passe et se passe) in history has no solid foundation, no indivisible line > requires a rethinking figure of threshold, requires greater vigilance to our irrepressible desire for single, solid threshold
give up linear history of epistēmēs (which Foucault and Agamben adhere to in spite of themselves), give up alternative of simultaneously synchronic and linear diachronic
call into question periodization not to reduce eventness or singularity, singularity makes it all the more irreducible and confusing
perhaps there never is any such threshold, perhaps that’s why we remain on it, why we risk staying on it forever

abyss not a bottom or bottomless depth of hidden base > if there is abyss, there’s plus d’un sol, plus d’un seul seuil, plus d’un seul seul [(no) more (than one) solid, single threshold, single single]

the untranslatability of bêtise (no word in world can translate it), even untranslatable from French into French > those who speak French, those privileged by the idiom, are commanded by complicated programs, contexts, pragmatic situations > privilege to unique event of language, the “poetic,” is contaminated by reactive or reactional animality [animal-machine]
certain indispensable schemata appear more clearly when you improvise
logos: language, discourse, reason, calculation, counting (ratio)

the (mis)translation of logos brings w/ it the whole of culture; whole force of history at work to produce this translation [logos as Christ] > whole of history at play in motif of beast & sovereign and their relation to zoōn: “there are no limits, no frontiers that can contain these issues of translation”
Aristotle: city is natural reality, man destined to live in city [Aristotle links politics & logos]
logocentrism: forced hegemony of logos as speech, a “European” operation, logocentrism of Abrahamic languages > everything organized based on forced translations
Aristotle: autarkeia (self-sufficiency), sovereign, has an end in himself, is best—self-sufficiency the end of everything
Aristotle: only under ruler are slaves and women distinguished; ox is poor man’s slave
Aristotle: those who foresee w/ mind naturally master, those who foresee w/ body naturally slave—both same interest [?]
acc. Aristotle, phonē (which animals also have) does not suffice to define logos
for Aristotle, kurios (sovereign), structural difference btwn state & family (latter comes first [historically]) > go to the arkhē to develop best view of things
phonocentrism, authority of the vocal, is universal: hegemony of logocentrism is not
Aristotle already described structure of biopolitics, just hadn’t seen, couldn’t have seen, all its figures
